meanings.sent1: I will divide the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: Can you divide the candies between the two of us?
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to divide the rabbit into two, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to divide the forest in half, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: She used a knife to carefully divide the paper along the dotted line.

meanings.definition: Cause to be separate or different
meanings.sent1: His actions will divide the group into two opposing sides.
meanings.sent2: The decision to move to a new city will divide our family.
meanings.sent3: The silly argument over ice cream flavors will divide us forever.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news seemed to divide their once strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The new rule will divide the students into those who agree and those who don't.

meanings.definition: Mark off or separate into sections
meanings.sent1: Please divide the page into three equal parts for the activity.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will divide the class into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: He tried to divide the map into neat sections, but it ended up messy.
meanings.sent4: The garden was divided into colorful sections of flowers and vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The city was divided into districts for better management.

meanings.definition: Be a dividing line or boundary
meanings.sent1: The tall fence will divide our backyard from the neighbor's.
meanings.sent2: The river serves to divide the two counties in this region.
meanings.sent3: The old stone wall seemed to divide the haunted house from the rest of the town.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range acts as a natural barrier to divide the two countries.
meanings.sent5: The road seemed to divide the forest into two distinct ecosystems.
